ygData.subject: Re: twinked? / EQ ettiquette
ygData.msgSnippet: Being a rather high level warrior.. I get inspected constantly by lowbies and I inspect/am inspected by people my level all the time.  It in no way bothers me,
ygData.messageBody:
Being a rather high level warrior.. I get inspected constantly by lowbies
and I inspect/am inspected by people my level all the time. It in no way
bothers me, and if it does, it just shows you're getting into the game a
little too much. The only time this should ever make you feel uneasy is if
you're on a PvP server because they're scoping for your items to see if they
should kill you usually. If this honestly bothers you, I would imagine you
the type of person who is claustrophobic or who gets upset if someone bumps
into you in the subway or something along those lines. Eventually, you'll
take it with an air of pride must likely, because it's usually just newbies
gawking over your equipment.

----- Original Message -----
From: Selene <selene1212@...>
To: <EverQuest@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, February 07, 2000 12:41 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] twinked? / EQ ettiquette


> From: Selene <selene1212@...>
>
>
>
> --- Lanadina the Magician <lanadina@...>
> wrote:
> > I'm thinking back in old school, when I first
> > started playing. The FBR back
> > then was the GOD robe....when the oracle robe
> > was found, people nearly fell
> > over themselves just to do an inspect on me <G>
> >
> > Lana
> >
>
> I find it kind of rude for people to be snooping
> in other peoples stuff! Is 'inspect' a totally
> accepted thing, or is there some sort of
> ettiquette that goes along with it? I don't mind
> so much if I've been chatting with someone for a
> little while and they take a peek [it's not like
> I have anything good to hide!] but when people
> come right up to you, snoop, and then don't even
> respond when you say 'Hail' , I find that
> extremely annoying. Any comments, guys?
>
> Sinarya
> 6th DE Necromancer
> Veeshan
>
> =====
> * Selene *
